Iran says there will be no new nuclear talks if US insists that it stop uranium enrichment
subhead: 'If the negotiations must be conditioned on stopping enrichment, such negotiations will not take place,' said an advisor to Iran's supreme leader on Monday. Israel and Western nations accuse Iran of pursuing nuclear weapons, a charge Tehran has consistently denied.

title: Bastille Day military parade showcases 'credibility' of French army
subhead: A combat force was deployed on the Champs-Élysées on Monday. The parade also spotlighted Indonesia, one of France's strategic partners in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: At Paris' Grand Palais, Denmark and France collaborate through tapestries
subhead: The New Carlsberg Foundation commissioned four Danish artists to design 16 tapestries that will decorate Koldinghus Castle in Denmark. Crafted by weavers from the French manufactories of Beauvais, Gobelins and Aubusson, these works are currently on display in Paris.

title: Harouna Sow, chef: 'Where I come from, men don't cook. It was a revelation for me'
subhead: Chef Harouna Sow, from the NGO Refugee Food, was born in Mauritania and grew up in Senegal and Mali before he came to France. He shares the story of Senegalese couscous, which reminds him of his roots and the first person who ever fed him.

title: The dazzling legacy of iconoclastic jewelry designer Attilio Codognato
subhead: Known for his snake- and skull-shaped jewelry, the iconoclastic designer who died in 2023 also left behind an astonishing collection of works by Andy Warhol, Marcel Duchamp and Maurizio Cattelan, now fiercely protected by his children. His Venetian boutique, once a magnet for global celebrities, remains the only place in the world to find Codognato's singular creations.

title: Syria's White Helmets undergo baptism by fire
subhead: In the Turkmen mountains in northwestern Syria, humanitarian workers who have become the new Syrian Civil Defense are battling wildfires that are devastating the forest.
